alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 11:21AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Marion, northwestern Fayette and northern Lamar Counties through NOON CDT... At 1120 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Beaverton, or 8 miles east of Sulligent, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Winfield, Vernon, Sulligent, Guin, Brilliant, Glen Allen, Detroit, Beaverton, Gu- Win, Weston, Bluff, Blooming Grove, Lamar County Airport, Crews, Bedford, Twin, Tucker, Henson Springs and Wayside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
